page.title: 04The Villages - Fingest.
page.content: The four villages are different in character and size. The majority of the older houses are flint faced, typical of chalk land building. The three in the valley are very old settlements. The Romans almost certainly settled there and there is strong evidence of Saxon occupation. The beauty of the countryside, the quietness, the network of footpaths, and the historic churches in the area attract thousands of visitors each year. FINGEST is the smallest with about thirty houses clustered near the church. The name has changed through the centuries -Thengest - Tingehurst - Â£at the hanging wood'. Hanger Wood over looks the village today. The 13th. century St. Bartholomew's Church, built of flint has a unique double gabled tower.
